result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Darryl T. Brown

defendant.name: Brown, Darryl T.
defendant.address: 104 1/2 North Rural St, Eau Claire, WI 54703

records.addlTxt: Status conference on December 22, 2022 at 01:00 pm.

9:32 am cases 21CF620, 22CF134, 22CF485, 22CF539 and 22CF1001 called and held via Zoom. Defendant Darryl T. Brown appeared by video with Attorney Robert Allen Thorson. Prosecuting attorney Monica A Fallon appeared by video for the State of Wisconsin. Defendant waives their right to appear in person and Court accepts waiver. 
In 21CF620, 22CF134, 22CF485, 22CF539: Defendant waives reading of Information and enters Not Guilty pleas- Received by the Court. Thirty days to file motions. 
A preliminary hearing is scheduled with Judge Barna on 12/22/22 at 1:00 pm in 22CF1001. All other files scheduled for a status conference on that date and time.

records.descr: Demand for Discovery and Inspection - Defendant

records.addlTxt:
2:45 PM 21CF620, 22CF134, 22CF485 & 22CF539. Defendant Darryl T. Brown in court, in custody.  Attorney Robert Allen Thorson in court for Darryl T. Brown.  Attorney Robert W. Stoiber in court for State of Wisconsin. This is the time and date set for a Preliminary Hearing in each of the files. The parties are ready to proceed. Defense asks that the witnesses be sequestered. Court grants Defense request. 

21CF620: State asks that Court take judicial notice of Eau Claire County case 17CF1466. Court takes notice. 
State calls Detective Olivia Erl, ECPD to the stand; sworn and testifies. Cross examination by Defense. Re-direct by State. Witness identifies the defendant and the record will so reflect. Witness steps down. 
State provides argument. Defense provides argument. Court finds probable cause and the matter is bound over. 

22CF134: State asks that Court take judicial notice of Eau Claire County case 21CF260. Court takes notice. 
State calls Officer Matthew Sanda, ECPD, who appears via Zoom video, to the stand; sworn and testifies. Witness identifies the defendant and the record will so reflect. Cross examination by Defense. Re-Direct by State. No argument by counsel. Court finds probable cause and the matter is bound over. Witness is excused.

22CF485: State calls Sgt. Jesse Henning, ECPD to the stand; sworn and testifies. Witness identifies the defendant and the record will so reflect. Cross examination by Defense. State asks that Court take judicial notice of Eau Claire County cases 21CF620 & 22CF134. Court takes notice. Witness is excused. State requests bind over. No argument by Defense. Court finds probable cause and the matter is bound over.

22CF539: State calls Deputy Trey Olson, ECSO to the stand; sworn and testifies. State asks that Court take judicial notice of Eau Claire County case 21CF620 and 19CF1111.  Witness identifies the defendant and the record will so reflect. Cross examination by Defense. Witness steps down. State provides argument and requests bind over. No argument by Defense. Court finds probable cause and the matter is bound over. 

All cases are referred to Br. 3 for further scheduling.

9:32 AM Cases called: 21CF620, 22CF134, 22CF485 & 22CF539 Prosecuting attorney Afton Brianna Lewis Ms. in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Darryl T. Brown in court, in custody.  Attorney Robert Allen Thorson in court for Darryl T. Brown. Defense would like a preliminary hearing in the felony cases.
Preliminary hearing scheduled for June 28, 2022 at 02:30 pm.
Preliminary hearing on June 28, 2022 at 02:30 pm.
Letter to defendant with signature bond ordered in court 04/28/2022. Request to return signed bond and Affidavit of Witness form to Clerk of Court no later than 05/09/2022.

Conditions: 
No contact with Fleet Farm

10:16 AM cases 22CF485, 21CF620, 22CF134 called. Prosecuting attorney Loralee Clark in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Darryl T. Brown appeared by phone.  Attorney Robert Allen Thorson in court for Darryl T. Brown. 
In 22CF485: Defense waives reading of the complaint and time limits for the preliminary hearing. 
All files: Pre-Trial Conference (by phone) with District Attorney's Office (715-839-4828) on 5/16/22 AT 3:00 pm. 
Return 6/8/22 at 9:30 AM.
